LandingPage.subtitle: Stop wasting time between apps. Ribotflow unifies your CRM, sales, and communications so you can focus on what really matters: growing your business.
LandingPage.feature1Title: All-in-One CRM for Freelancers and SMEs
LandingPage.feature1Text: Simplify your business management with a centralized system. 360Â° client view, complete interaction history, and Kanban sales pipeline to reduce time and errors.
LandingPage.feature2Text: Sync your email to automatically convert new contacts into leads. Schedule and automate posts to your social media to always stay present.
LandingPage.feature3Text: Discover and collaborate with other nearby professionals. The community map allows you to offer services, search for collaborators, or share resources within your sector and area.
LandingPage.feature4Text: Receive an instant summary of pending invoices, tasks, and appointments directly on Telegram. Your assistant keeps you informed without constantly logging in.
LandingPage.feature5Text: Always up to date with grants available in your sector and location. Don't let funding opportunities for your business slip away.
LandingPage.feature6Text: AI scores leads, suggests responses, and detects hidden opportunities. Customizable dashboards show key metrics so you can make decisions with confidence.

CountdownView.subtitle: Stop wasting time between apps. Ribotflow unifies your CRM, sales, and communications so you can focus on what really matters: growing your business.
CountdownView.feature1Text: Simplify your business management with a centralized system.
CountdownView.feature2Text: Sync your email and automate posts to social media.
CountdownView.feature3Text: Discover and collaborate with other nearby professionals on the community map.

MainLandingView.title: Your life's work, powered by our passion.
MainLandingView.subtitle: Robust and reliable software solutions that improve the way you work. Designed for businesses of all sizes.

section1.title: 1. Who is the Controller of your data?

content.p1: The controller for the personal data collected through the Ribotflow platform is {companyName}, with VAT ID {companyVat}, address at {companyAddress}, and contact email {companyEmail}.

section2.title: 2. What data do we process and for what purpose?

content.p1: We collect and process different types of personal data depending on your interaction with Ribotflow:
content.item1: Identification and contact data (name, surname, email, phone) you provide during registration or when contacting us.
content.item2: Professional data (company name, job title) if you provide them.
content.item3: Data you enter into the platform about your own clients, suppliers, invoices, quotes, opportunities, expenses, and other activities related to managing your business.
content.item4: Technical and usage data (IP address, browser type, pages visited, usage time) collected automatically for the operation and improvement of the service.
content.item5: Billing and payment data (if paid subscription plans apply).
content.p2: The main purposes of the processing are:
content.purpose1: To provide, manage, and maintain the Ribotflow service.
content.purpose2: To communicate with you for matters related to the service, technical support, or administrative information.
content.purpose3: To improve the platform, analyze usage, and develop new functionalities.
content.purpose4: To ensure the security of the platform and prevent fraud.
content.purpose5: To comply with our legal obligations.

section3.title: 3. What is the legal basis for the processing?

content.p1: The legal basis that allows us to process your data varies depending on the purpose:
content.basis1: The performance of the service contract you accept when you register and use Ribotflow.
content.basis2: Your explicit consent for specific purposes, such as sending marketing communications (if applicable).
content.basis3: Our legitimate interest in improving the service, ensuring security, or managing inquiries.
content.basis4: Compliance with applicable legal obligations (e.g., billing).

content.p1: It is important to note that regarding the personal data of your own clients, suppliers, or third parties that you enter and manage in Ribotflow (such as names, emails, billing data, etc.), you are the Data Controller. We act solely as Data Processor, following your instructions and processing this data exclusively to provide you with the contracted service.
content.p2: Our obligations as Data Processor are detailed in the [Terms and Conditions of Service](link), which include the Data Processing Agreement (DPA) required by the GDPR.

section5.title: 5. With whom do we share your data?

content.p1: We do not sell or rent your personal data. We only share it with third parties when necessary to provide the service or due to legal obligation:
content.item1: Technology service providers: We use {provider} as a cloud infrastructure provider (database, authentication, storage).
content.p2: Some of these providers may be located outside the European Economic Area, but we guarantee that appropriate measures are taken to ensure an equivalent level of protection (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses).

section6.title: 6. How long do we keep your data?

content.p1: Your personal data will be kept as long as you maintain an active account in Ribotflow and, subsequently, for the legally established periods to address possible responsibilities.

section7.title: 7. What are your rights and how to exercise them?

content.p1: You have the right to access, rectify, delete your data, as well as to limit or object to its processing, and to data portability, under the terms established by current legislation.
content.p2: You can exercise these rights by sending an email to {email} attaching a copy of your identity document.
content.p3: You also have the right to file a complaint with the Spanish Data Protection Agency (www.aepd.es) if you consider that your rights have not been duly addressed.

content.p1: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal data against loss, unauthorized access, or unlawful processing.
We may modify this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page and, if significant, we will notify you by email or through the platform.

In compliance with the duty of information stipulated in Law 34/2002 on Information Society Services and Electronic Commerce (LSSI-CE), the following data is provided: The owner of this website and the Ribotflow application is {companyName}, with VAT ID {companyVat}, address at {companyAddress}, and contact email {companyEmail}. {companyRegistry}
This Legal Notice regulates access to and use of the website and the {appName} application (hereinafter, the "Platform"), which {companyName} makes available to Internet users.

All intellectual and industrial property rights of the Platform ({appName}), including, but not limited to, its source code, graphic design, interfaces, texts, images, videos, sounds, trademarks, logos, and trade names, are the exclusive property of {companyName} or third parties who have authorized their use.
content.p2: The user acknowledges that the data and information entered by them into the Platform are their exclusive property and responsibility. {companyName} acts as a mere depository of this information within the framework of providing the service.

content.p1: Access and/or use of the Platform attributes the condition of User, who accepts, from said access and/or use, the general conditions of use reflected here.
content.p2: The User agrees to make appropriate use of the content and services that {companyName} offers through its Platform and, by way of example but not limitation, not to use them for:
content.obligation1: Engaging in illicit, illegal, or activities contrary to good faith and public order.
content.obligation2: Disseminating content or propaganda of a racist, xenophobic, pornographic-illegal nature, advocating terrorism, or violating human rights.
content.obligation3: Causing damage to the physical and logical systems of {companyName}, its suppliers, or third parties, introducing or spreading computer viruses or any other physical or logical systems that are likely to cause the aforementioned damage.

content.p1: {companyName} is not responsible, in any case, for damages of any kind that may be caused, by way of example: errors or omissions in the content, lack of availability of the Platform, or the transmission of viruses or malicious or harmful programs in the content, despite having adopted all necessary technological measures to prevent it.
content.p2: The use that users may make of the data and information supplied through the Platform is done under their sole and exclusive responsibility.

content.p1: In the event that the Platform provides links or hyperlinks to other Internet sites, {companyName} will not exercise any type of control over said sites and content. In no case will {companyName} assume any responsibility for the content of any link belonging to a third-party website.
The processing of personal data and the use of cookies on the Platform are governed by our

{companyName} reserves the right to make, without prior notice, the modifications it deems appropriate to its Platform, and may change, delete, or add both the content and services provided through it and the way in which they are presented or located.

The relationship between {companyName} and the User will be governed by current Spanish regulations, and any controversy will be submitted to the Courts and tribunals of the city of [Your city / as indicated by the lawyer].

These Terms and Conditions of Service (hereinafter, "Terms") govern the use of the {appName} platform (hereinafter, "Service" or "Platform"), owned by {companyName}. By registering or using the Service, you agree to be bound by these Terms.
content.p2: Use of the Service also implies acceptance of our Privacy Policy.

content.p1: {appName} is a business management platform that offers tools for CRM, invoicing, expense management, communication, and other related functionalities. Specific features may vary depending on the contracted plan (if applicable).
To use the Service, you must register by creating an account. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your password and for all activities that occur under your account.
content.p2: You must provide truthful, accurate, and complete information during registration and keep it updated.
content.p3: We reserve the right to suspend or cancel accounts that violate these Terms.

content.p1: By using the Service, you agree to:
content.obligation1: Use the Platform lawfully and in accordance with these Terms.
content.obligation2: Not engage in activities that could damage, overload, or impair the normal operation of the Service.
content.obligation3: Be solely responsible for the legality, accuracy, and ownership of the data you enter into the Platform.
content.obligation4: Respect the intellectual property rights of {companyName} and third parties.

content.p1: [If free: The Service is provided free of charge under the conditions described herein. We reserve the right to introduce paid plans in the future.] / [If paid: Detail plans, pricing, billing cycles, payment methods, refund policy, consequences of non-payment, etc., here. This section is CRITICAL and requires detailed legal advice.]
The {appName} Platform and all its content (excluding data entered by the user) are the property of {companyName} and are protected by intellectual property laws.
content.p2: The data you enter into the Platform is yours. You grant us a limited license to process this data solely for the purpose of providing the Service.

content.p1: The processing of your personal data is governed by our
content.dpaTitle: Role as Data Processor (Data Processing Agreement - DPA)
content.dpaP1: Regarding the personal data of third parties (your clients, suppliers, etc.) that you enter into {appName}, you act as the Data Controller, and we act as the Data Processor. These Terms constitute the Data Processing Agreement (DPA) required by regulations.
content.dpaP2: We commit to: (a) Process this data solely on your instructions and for the provision of the Service. (b) Ensure the confidentiality of the data. (c) Implement appropriate security measures. (d) Not subcontract without your prior authorization. (e) Assist you in complying with your obligations as Controller (exercise of rights, breach notifications). (f) Delete the data once the service is terminated, according to legal terms. (g) Make available to you the information necessary to demonstrate compliance.

content.p1: The Service is provided "as is," without warranties of any kind, either express or implied. We do not guarantee that the Service will be uninterrupted, secure, or error-free.
content.p2: To the maximum extent permitted by law, {companyName} shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, or any loss of profits or revenues, loss of data, or other intangible losses, resulting from (i) your access to or use of or inability to access or use the service; (ii) any conduct or content of any third party on the service; (iii) any content obtained from the service; and (iv) unauthorized access, use, or alteration of your transmissions or content.

content.p1: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. We will notify you of significant changes. If you continue to use the Service after the modification, you will be deemed to have accepted the new Terms.
These Terms will remain in effect while you use the Service. You may cancel your account at any time.
content.p2: We may suspend or terminate your access to the Service if you breach these Terms.

content.p1: These Terms shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of Spain. Any dispute related to these Terms shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of [Your city / as indicated by the lawyer].

A cookie is a small text file that a website stores on your computer or mobile device when you visit the site. It enables the website to remember your actions and preferences (such as login, language, font size, and other display preferences) over a period of time, so you don't have to keep re-entering them whenever you come back to the site or browse from one page to another.

section2.title: 2. What types of Cookies do we use and why?

content.p1: At {appName}, we primarily use the following types of cookies:

type1.name: Technical or Necessary Cookies
type1.description: These are essential for the proper functioning of the Platform. They allow navigation and the use of different options or services, such as, for example, controlling traffic and data communication, identifying the session, accessing restricted access parts, remembering the elements that make up an order, carrying out the purchase process of an order, making the request for registration or participation in an event, using security elements during navigation, storing content for the dissemination of videos or sound, or sharing content through social networks.
type1.cookie1: Authentication cookie (e.g., {name}): Allows keeping your session logged in.
type1.cookie2: Preference cookie (e.g., {name}): Remembers the selected language.

type2.name: Analysis or Measurement Cookies
type2.description: (IF USED) These cookies allow us to quantify the number of users and thus carry out the measurement and statistical analysis of the use made by users of the service offered. For this, your navigation on our website is analyzed in order to improve the offer of products or services that we offer you.
type2.thirdPartyInfo: (IF THIRD-PARTY) The information is collected and processed by [Name of third party, e.g., Google Analytics]. You can find more information about how Google processes data in its privacy policy.

content.p1: You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer, and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed.
content.p2: Below, we provide links where you will find information on how to configure your preferences in the main browsers:
content.p3: Additionally, you can manage consent for non-essential cookies through the cookie banner that appears when accessing our Platform [Or link to a management tool if you implement one].

content.p1: For more information on how we process your personal data, please see our
We may update the Cookie Policy of our Platform, so we recommend you review this policy each time you access our website in order to be adequately informed about how and why we use cookies.

Billing.title: Billing and Plans
Billing.description: Manage your subscription, view billing history, and update payment details.
Billing.upgrade_notice_desc: You are currently on the {planName} plan. To access this feature, please upgrade your plan.
Billing.limitReachedDefault: You have reached the contact limit allowed in your current plan. Upgrade to add more.
Billing.permissionDenied: You do not have permission to access this billing section.
Billing.subscriptionCheckFailed: Error verifying your subscription. Could not start import.
Billing.countCheckFailed: Error counting current records. Could not start import.
Billing.importLimitExceeded: Could not import. Your plan has a limit of {planLimit} records. You already have {currentCount}, so you can only add {availableQuota} more. The file you uploaded contains {newRecordsCount}.

Transcripcio.listDescription: Manage your recordings and extracted tasks.
Transcripcio.pendingDescription: Your audio is being analyzed. This may take a few minutes.
Transcripcio.failedDescription: There was an error processing the audio:
Transcripcio.keyMomentsEmpty: No key moments have been extracted from this transcription.
Transcripcio.keyMomentsNoWork: The analysis did not find any relevant work topics in this conversation.
Transcripcio.createTaskDialogDescription: The task will be added to the activity list.
Transcripcio.deleteDialogDescription: This action is permanent and cannot be undone. It will delete the job, the audio, and the associated transcription.
Transcripcio.errorLoading: Could not load the transcription job or you do not have access.
Transcripcio.sendEmailNoRecipients: No recipients with valid email found among participants.

Email.sendSuccess: The email with the meeting summary has been sent successfully to {recipientCount} recipients.

Global.error: An error occurred. If the problem persists, contact support.
